sentences.en: Actually I was not that anguished, just wanted to abreact.
sentences.cn: 其实我也不是那样痛苦的, 只是想写出来发泄一下.

sentences.en: An anguished look appeared on her face.
sentences.cn: 她面上浮现尴尬的表情.

sentences.en: Anguished at its misfortune, angered by its unwillingness to fight.
sentences.cn: 这是鲁迅先生所说,但应该是哀其不幸, 怒其不争.是不是你打错了.

sentences.en: Being confused and anguished, he a Buddhist monk.
Bill's anguished mother met me in the doorway.
sentences.cn: 比尔的痛苦的母亲在门口会我.

sentences.en: Desmond eyed her anguished face with sympathy.
sentences.cn: 看着她痛苦的脸,德斯蒙德觉得理解.

sentences.en: He took an anguished breath. He had to be brutal and say it.
sentences.cn: 他痛苦地吸了口气，不得不坦言此事。

sentences.en: He was anguished after falling off the balcony.
sentences.cn: 从阳台摔下来之后,他全身疼痛难忍.

sentences.en: He was anguished by the death of his grandmother.
sentences.cn: 他因祖母的去世而悲伤不已.

sentences.en: She let out an anguished cry.
The threatened sob welled up into a dry, anguished scream.
sentences.cn: 被威胁的啜泣涌出在进入乾之内上面, 痛苦的尖叫声.
受害人发出痛苦的呼喊.

sentences.en: Their wounds like flames eat their anguished flesh.
sentences.cn: 他们的伤象火焰似的烧灼着他们痛楚的肉体.

trans.tran_en: Anguished means showing or feeling great mental suffering or physical pain
